AQI (Air Quality Index) is a standardized indicator that measures how polluted the air is. It ranges from 0 to 500:

🟢 0-50: Good
🟡 51-100: Satisfactory
🟠 101-200: Moderate
🔴 201-300: Poor
🟣 301-400: Very Poor
🟤 401-500: Severe

Lower values mean cleaner, healthier air!

PM2.5 refers to fine particulate matter with a diameter of 2.5 micrometers or smaller (about 3% the diameter of a human hair!). 🔬

These tiny particles can:
• Penetrate deep into lungs
• Enter the bloodstream
• Cause respiratory problems
• Aggravate heart disease
• Reduce life expectancy

✅ Safe level: 0-30 µg/m³
⚠️ Unhealthy: Above 60 µg/m³

PM10 refers to coarse particulate matter with a diameter of 10 micrometers or smaller. These particles include:

• Dust
• Pollen
• Mold spores
• Combustion particles

PM10 can irritate the eyes, nose, and throat, but is less dangerous than PM2.5 since it doesn't penetrate as deeply into the lungs.

✅ Safe level: 0-50 µg/m³

Here are health recommendations based on current air quality:

🟢 Good (0-50): Enjoy outdoor activities!

🟡 Satisfactory (51-100): Most people can be outdoors. Sensitive individuals should watch for symptoms.

🟠 Moderate (101-200): 
• Limit prolonged outdoor exertion
• Sensitive groups: reduce outdoor activity
• Wear N95 masks if needed

🔴 Poor (201-300):
• Minimize outdoor activities
• Keep windows closed
• Use air purifiers indoors
• Wear masks when outside

🟣 Very Poor/Severe (301+):
• Stay indoors
• Avoid all physical activities outdoors
• Use air purifiers
• Consult doctor if experiencing symptoms

patterns: Why is Silkboard usually more polluted?
What are the main sources of PM2.5 here?
responses:
Main sources of air pollution in Bengaluru:

🚗 Vehicular Emissions (60-70%)
• Cars, buses, trucks, two-wheelers
• Major contributor to NOx, CO, PM

🏭 Industrial Emissions (15-20%)
• Factories in Peenya, Whitefield
• Release PM, SO2, heavy metals

🏗️ Construction Activity (10-15%)
• Dust from building sites
• Road construction

🔥 Biomass Burning
• Crop burning in nearby areas
• Garbage burning

🏠 Domestic Sources
• Cooking fuels
• Generator sets

patterns: How can I reduce my exposure today?
What should I do to avoid pollution outdoors?
Tips for commuting in high pollution
How do I keep indoor air clean?
What to do when AQI is high?
How to protect children from pollution?
responses:
Ways to reduce pollution exposure:

🏠 Indoors:
• Use air purifiers with HEPA filters
• Keep windows closed on high pollution days
• Ventilate during early morning (6-8 AM)
• Add indoor plants (but don't rely on them alone)

🚶 Outdoors:
• Wear N95/N99 masks
• Avoid peak traffic hours (8-11 AM, 5-9 PM)
• Choose less-trafficked routes
• Exercise early morning or late evening
• Stay away from construction sites

🚗 Commuting:
• Use public transport
• Keep car windows closed
• Use cabin air filters
• Avoid idling in traffic

💪 Health:
• Stay hydrated
• Eat antioxidant-rich foods
• Regular health check-ups

People most sensitive to air pollution:

👶 Children
• Lungs still developing
• Breathe more air per body weight
• More active outdoors

👴 Elderly (65+)
• Weakened immune systems
• Often have pre-existing conditions

🫁 People with Respiratory Conditions
• Asthma
• COPD
• Bronchitis

❤️ Heart Disease Patients
• Pollution can trigger heart attacks
• Aggravates existing conditions

🤰 Pregnant Women
• Risk to fetal development
• Can affect birth weight

💪 Athletes & Outdoor Workers
• Higher breathing rates
• More exposure

These groups should take extra precautions during high pollution days!

patterns: Best time of year for air quality
Why is air quality worse in winter?
Is monsoon season better for air quality?
responses:
Seasonal pollution patterns in Bengaluru:

🥶 Winter (Nov-Feb): WORST
• Temperature inversion traps pollutants
• Low wind speeds
• Crop burning in nearby states
• Diwali firecrackers (Oct-Nov)

☀️ Summer (Mar-May): MODERATE
• Higher temperatures aid dispersion
• But dust storms increase PM10
• Construction activity peaks

🌧️ Monsoon (Jun-Sep): BEST
• Rain washes out pollutants
• Cleaner air
• Less dust

🍂 Post-Monsoon (Oct): MODERATE
• Transition period
• Festival season begins
• Air quality starts deteriorating

Best time for outdoor activities: During and after monsoon (June-October)!

For AI-powered air quality predictions, please visit the Dashboard! 📊

Our ML ensemble model (Random Forest + XGBoost) can predict PM2.5 levels based on:
• Current pollutant levels
• Historical patterns
• Meteorological conditions
• Time of day

Click the '🔮 Predict PM2.5 & AQI' button on the Dashboard for real-time predictions with SHAP explanations!

Just ask your question naturally, and I'll do my best to help! 😊

NO2 (Nitrogen Dioxide) is a reddish-brown gas formed by:

🚗 Vehicle exhausts (major source)
🏭 Industrial processes
⚡ Power plants

Health Effects:
• Irritates airways
• Aggravates asthma
• Increases respiratory infections
• Reduces lung function

✅ Safe level: <40 µg/m³ (annual avg)
⚠️ Alert: >200 µg/m³ (hourly avg)

CO (Carbon Monoxide) is a colorless, odorless gas produced by incomplete combustion:

🚗 Vehicle emissions (primary source)
🏭 Industrial processes
🔥 Biomass burning

Health Effects:
• Reduces oxygen delivery to organs
• Causes headaches, dizziness
• Impairs vision and coordination
• Fatal at high concentrations

✅ Safe level: <2 mg/m³ (8-hour avg)
⚠️ Dangerous: >10 mg/m³

Ozone (O3) at ground level is a harmful pollutant (though beneficial in the upper atmosphere!).

How it forms:
☀️ Sunlight + NOx + VOCs → Ozone

Highest during sunny afternoons!

Health Effects:
• Irritates lungs
• Triggers asthma
• Reduces lung function
• Damages lung tissue

✅ Safe level: <100 µg/m³ (8-hour avg)
⚠️ Unhealthy: >160 µg/m³

patterns: Do I need an N95 right now?
Should I wear N95 in Peenya today?
Is a cloth mask enough for pollution?
Which mask is best for PM2.5?
When should I wear a mask outside?
N95 or N99 for today’s air?
responses:
Mask recommendations based on AQI:

🟢 Good (0-50): No mask needed

🟡 Satisfactory (51-100): Optional for sensitive groups

🟠 Moderate (101-200): 
• Recommended for sensitive groups
• N95 or N99 masks

🔴 Poor (201-300):
• Everyone should wear N95/N99 masks outdoors
• Ensure proper fit

🟣 Very Poor/Severe (301+):
• N99 masks mandatory
• Stay indoors as much as possible

💡 Tips:
• Cloth masks don't filter PM2.5
• Change masks regularly
• Ensure no gaps around edges
• Children need properly sized masks

patterns: Is an air purifier worth it in Bengaluru?
Which HEPA rating should I buy?
How do I size an air purifier for my room?
Should I run purifier all day?
Do air purifiers remove PM2.5 effectively?
responses:
Air Purifier Guide:

✅ Do They Work?
Yes! HEPA filters can remove 99.97% of PM2.5 particles.

🔍 What to Look For:
• True HEPA filter (H13 or H14)
• Appropriate CADR for room size
• Carbon filter for gases
• Low noise level
• Energy efficient

📍 Where to Place:
• Bedroom (spend 8+ hours)
• Living room
• Near windows/doors
• Away from walls (airflow)

🔧 Maintenance:
• Change filters every 6-12 months
• Clean pre-filters monthly
• Keep doors/windows closed

💡 Alternatives:
• Ventilate during early morning
• Indoor plants (limited effect)
• Minimize indoor pollution sources
